turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hey, how are you?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Hi! I'm feeling great today.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: What did you do today?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I played a baskeball match this morning.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: How was it? Did you win?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Yes!! And I scored 40 points.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Wow! You did an amazing match! Did the sport afect your glucose?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, my sugar level was low after lunch."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Did you inject too much insulin?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I didn't take into account the exercise."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Next time, think about the exercise when you calculate the insulin dose."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Yes I will.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hi, how is it going?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Great, I had a very good blood glucose level today."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "That's nice, keep it up! Having a good glucose level is great."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Thank you! But it may rise this afternoon.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Why is that?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Because I just ate a big sandwich now.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: And did you put your insulin?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, but maybe it was not enough."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Then you should check your glucose in an hour and a half and correct the dose if necessary.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Thanks for your advice.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "No problem, see you later."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Till later.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hi, I need your help."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I forgot to put my insulin after lunch and now I have a high sugar level.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Don't worry, you can put your insulin now and it will reduce."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: How much insulin should I put?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Calculate your insulin dose taking into account when did you eat and your actual sugar level.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Ok, I will do that."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You should also consider if you did some exercise today.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "No, I was home all day."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Maybe you should do some exercise, it will also help to reduce your blood sugar level."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Perfect, I will go to do some running now. See you."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Have a nice day, bye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Bye bye.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hi, what are you going to do today?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I'm going to the mountain.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Be careful if you are going to walk a lot, you may need to decrease your insulin dose."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I will decrease my insulin dose and I will also eat some cookies before leaving."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Well done, but it is possible that you need to check your glucose level during the day."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Ok, but what should I do if my blood glucose level is low?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You should always have sugar in your bag in case your blood glucose drops.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Does it have to be sugar?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "No, you could also drink a juice with enough amount of carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, that is all I need to know."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Enjoy your day on the mountain.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I will, bye!"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hello, how are you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I am feeling stressed lately.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: What is making you feel that way?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I have a very important exam today and I cannot fail.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Have you studied for the exam?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I was studying all this week for my exam and I think this affected my blood glucose.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I couldn't control my blood sugar level very good this week, it was always high."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Did you change yor diet or insulin dose?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "No, I kept them the same as usual."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: The stress from the exam is probably causing this rise in your glucose level.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Will it improve after I finish my exam?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: The glucose level will surely improve after you finish.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "See you, bye."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: See you.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: How are you feeling today?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hey, I am not feeling right."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: How come?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I think I got a virus and I have stomachache.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Did this affect your glucose levels?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I think so. My glucose is abnormally high since my stomach started hurting."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "This is normal, you should rise your insulin doses until you get better."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "All right, I hope this helps me to have a better glucose control."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Anyways, it should improve after you heal from the stomachache."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I hope I heal soon.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I hope so too. Bye.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: bye.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, what did you do yesterday?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I spent the whole day chilling and I went to a fancy restaurant for dinner.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Nice! What did you order?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I had a big steak with french fries and a cheesecake for dessert.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Sounds delicious. Did you have to inject a big dose of insulin?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I injected 15 units of fast action insulin. "

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I see, the fries and the cheesecake have a lot of carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I had a good level of blood glucose two hours after dinner, but this morning I woke up quite high."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: What was your blood glucose level this morning?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "245, a bit higher than I would like."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: It's difficult to maintain always a good blood glucose level. Are you gonna do something to improve it?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I'm going for a walk in the park now.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, enjoy your walk."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You enjoy your day too, bye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Hi!!!

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I am very excited! I have a date this afternoon.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: We are going to do ice skating.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: That sounds great!

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, and after skating we will get some pizzas."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hmmm I love pizza, but remember pizza has a high amount of carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I know, but it shouldn't affect my sugar level that much because I will skate this afternoon."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Don't forget to measure your blood sugar level one hour and a half after dinner.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I will, just in case I have to correct my insulin dose or eat more carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Enjoy your date.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Thanks! I will tell you how it ends.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Goodbye!

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: See you soon.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Good morning!

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, it's nice to see you here again. How are you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I woke up low today.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Oh, that's sad. Did you eat some sugar to recover?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "No, I had an orange juice and now I am feeling fine."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: That's great. Do you know why this happened?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I think I calculated my dinner insulin dose incorrectly.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: You can also try to calculate more precisely the carbohidrate amount in your dinner.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I will try to eat more next time. I have to go, I'll talk to you later."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Have a nice day, goodbye."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: See you.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, I have amazing news to tell you."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You seem very excited. What's the matter?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I am going to get married next Sunday!!!

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Congratulations! Are you ready for the day?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, but I feel very nervous because I still have things to prepare for the wedding."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I think the wedding is gonna be great, so you shouldn't overthink it."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, but it is inevitable. I think it is also affecting my glucose levels."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Have you noticed a rise in your glucose levels lately?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Then let's hope everything works out great.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Thank you very much! See you.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Talk to you later, bye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Not much, I am lying in the sofa watching a movie with some popcorn."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: That sounds like a great plan to me.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Well, I wanted to go out with friends for dinner because I stayed the whole day at home."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Let me guess. Your friends were not free today?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You got it right.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: And how was your glucose today? A lack of exercise tends to increase the glucose levels.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, they were a bit high, but I really wanted to have some popcorn."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: You should increase your insulin dose if you want to have a good glucose level.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I am going to put insulin right now, thanks for the advice."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "No problem, I hope you enjoy the movie."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Thanks, talk to you tomorrow."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Have a good night!

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hey, how are you doing?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Fine, but I could be doing better."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: How come? Did something happen?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Every morning I wake up with my sugar a bit high, even if I went to bed with a good sugar level."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: It could be related to the carbohidrate amount in your dinner.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "No, I don't think so. I eat different food and inject my insulin dose accordingly, but after four or five hours my sugar increases."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Did you change your insulin type or your lifestyle?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I had a leg injury and I've stopped doing sport, and in the past I used to do a lot."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: That could be the cause behind your rise in glucose.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I suppose so. Should I increase my insulin dose?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You probably should increase the dose, but speak with your doctor first."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Thanks, I will contact my doctor to solve this problem."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Great, have a nice day."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "You too, bye!"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hi, are you awake?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I am. What's the matter?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I just woke up in the middle of the night and I cannot sleep again.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Did you check your glucose level?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I didn't think about that, I will check it right now."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Okay, I will wait here."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "My blood glucose level is 56, so I am a bit low."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: You should eat 5g of sugar or a fast acting glucose like a fruit juice.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I will eat something now. How did you think about the glucose level?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: When you wake up in the middle of the night and you cannot sleep even though you are tired is because your body is not ok.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Nice to know. Next time I will check my glucose for sure.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, but be careful. You may need to eat something else."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I will also eat a banana. Thanks."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: You're wellcome. Good night.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: How was your afternoon? What did you do?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Oh hi! My afternoon was amazing, I went to a rock concert with my girlfriend."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: That is really cool.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, and we also had some beers during the concert. It was amazing."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: That sounds really good.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, but now my glucose level is a bit high."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Could this be related to the beers?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I am sure that is the cause. I also danced in the concert, so I didn't put any insulin during the concert."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Seems that the exercise you did while dancing in the concert wasn't enough to lower your glucose level.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "No, so now I have to inject some insulin."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Be careful. Even if you have high glucose right now, you still did some exercise and it could affect your glucose later."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Well thought!! I will decrease my insulin dose a little bit.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Okay, but don't forget to check your glucose level one and a half hours after the insulin injection."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Don't worry, I will."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Great to hear. Have a good night.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You too, good night."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, what are you doing right now?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hi, I just finished cooking the lunch for today."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: What did you prepare?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I cooked a whole turkey in the oven with some potatoes.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: It sounds delicious. I assume you are not gonna eat a whole turkey alone?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Of course not! I am inviting my family for lunch.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I hope you have a wonderful lunch. Don't forget to inject a correct dose of insulin, potatoes have a lot of carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I already thought about that, so I will increase my insulin dose today."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Fantastic. Don't forget to measure your blood glucose level one hour and a half after your lunch.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I will set an alarm so I don't forget about that. My family is coming, so I have to leave you now."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Enjoy your lunch with your family. Bye.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Thank you, goodbye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hi, how are you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Everything fine. And you?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I'm very tired today.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: What did you do?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I worked all day in a storehouse packing material and moving boxes.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Wow, it seems you had an exhausting day. Could you control your glucose fine?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I measured my glucose before lunch and I was quite good, at 85. However, I didn't check it again since then."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You should check it again now, you did a lot of exercise. What did you eat for lunch?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I had a salad and a steak with potatoes, and I injected 5 units of fast action insulin."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You should check your glucose level again now, maybe you didn't eat enough carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "It seems I didn't, I am at 46 now. What should I eat?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Since no fast action insulin is acting now, you should improve only by having 5 g of sugar or 200 cl of juice with sugar."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Ok I will go to eat now. See you later.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "See you, goodbye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, how is your day going?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Not bad, and yours?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I'm also fine, but somehow I don't feel quite well."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Oh, I'm sorry. Why is that?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Because no matter how much water I drink, I still feel thirsty."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: That is a common symptom of having a high blood glucose level. Have you checked it?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "No, I didn't check it. I actually drank a beer one hour ago, could this be affecting my glucose?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, that beer is definetely the cause for your thirst. However, you should check your glucose."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Ok, I did check it and I was at 320, quite high. I'm gonna put some fast action insulin to be good again."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, but measure your insulin dose carefully or you may get down on blood glucose."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I have injected 7 units of insulin. I hope the thirst disappears soon.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I'm sure it will. Think about this the next time you drink a beer.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Sure I will, thanks for your help."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "You're welcome, you can contact me anytime you feel like this."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "See you later, bye."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hi, how are you feeling today?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: My head is a bit dizzy. I think my glucose is low.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I think so too, you should eat something to raise your glucose."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I was thinking about eating some cheese.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Cheese is tasty, but it's not the best thing for you right now. You have to eat a bit of sugar, or a juice."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Ok, but I really want to eat cheese."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Then you should eat the cheese with some bread, it will also help to raise your glucose."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I will do that.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "But first you should drink a juice, it will make you feel better."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Ok, I will drink a juice and eat bread with cheese."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Right, but be careful with the bread, too much could raise your glucose too much."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I will only have a slice of bread.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Perfect, enjoy your food."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Thank you, bye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hey, how are you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I'm fine, and you?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Also fine. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I have just finished cooking my dinner.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: What did you cook for dinner?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I grilled chicken breast and also cooked some rice.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "That sounds good, but do you know that rice has a lot of carbohidrates?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes I do, so I will inject a higher than usual dose of insulin."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, but don't forget to measure your blood glucose level one hour and a half after your insulin injection."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I will measure it, because last time I didn't do it and my glucose rose higher than I wanted."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "You have to be careful with some food like potatoes, rice or pasta."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes. I will leave now, my chicken will cool if I wait more."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Okay, enjoy your dinner. Talk to you tomorrow."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Ok, goodbye."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Hello, how are you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I'm great, and you?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Quite bad, my blood glucose is really high."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You should inject insulin to reduce your blood glucose.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "I know, but I'm going to a football match now and I don't want to have a low glucose level during the match."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "But if you don't inject insulin it is possible that you have a high glucose for a long time, and you won't feel good."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Ok, then what should I do?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: You should speak with your doctor to be certain on what to do.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I will speak with him and try to improve my blood glucose level."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I hope you win your football match.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I hope so too. See you later.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Bye, see you soon."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hey, what's up?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I'm very nervous. What about you?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I'm fine. Why are you so nervous?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: I have a very important exam this afternoon and I cannot fail.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Have you studied for your exam?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I have studied but I haven't been able to control my glucose lately. I fear to be low during my exam."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: How is your blood glucose level now?

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "It is good, 92. But I don't know if it will reduce until my exam."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Maybe you could eat something with low carbohidrate amount to raise a little bit your blood glucose.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Yes, I want to do that but I don't know what to eat."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Maybe a small biscuit or some fruit, no more than 5g of carbohidrates."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, I will eat a small banana then."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Enjoy your banana and good luck on your exam.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Thank you, see you later."

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Hey!!

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Hello, how are you feeling today?"

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "Great, and you?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: I feel horrible today. Yesterday I had a big party and today I have hangover.

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: "If you feel really bad, you could take an ibuprofen. How was your party?"

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "It was great, we played some drinking games, ate some pizzas and danced till the morning."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: It sounds amazing. Did you check your glucose during the party?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "No, I checked it before going to bed and I was quite high, so I had to inject insulin."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: And what was your glucose level when you woke up?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I was still high, but I should be fine."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Did you inject your slow action insulin?

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "I should have, but I don't really remember if I injected during the party."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: That could explain why you woke up high. You should speak with your doctor to know what you should do.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Yes, I will. At least this will make my hangover better."

turns.speaker: Patient
turns.text: Definetely. I hope you get better soon.

turns.speaker: Doctor
turns.text: "Thanks, talk to you later."
